38896196.review:
You like Danganronpa? then play it. It shows more of the world outside of the killing games and gives a very different style of gameplay than the other entries in the series, which still feels very danganronpa. It's fully english voice-acted and has options to switch to japanes voice acting if preferred. ~18 hours play time and that's more than fine for €18.75 on sale.

Although I do have some complaints, mainly with the Monoku-man(/puzzle) sections. 

First every puzzle is different and complex enough to be fun, but they can lead to frustations. mainly due to the fact that you have to use the limited amount of bullets that you have on you at the moment, they give you a box to replenish one kind of bullet, but it's randomized and often it's a bullet you are not allowed to use during the puzzle anyway, which is very frustating since you do know the answer, you just can't solve it.

Second the set-up of each puzzle gets somewhat tiring. I'm more than fine to have puzzle segments(,since they give the needed variety of the overall gameplay), but they should have more variety in the set-up of each puzzle. It's always shoot the monokuman machine, then look around with a birds-eye view and use the appropriate bullets in the correct order on the monokumas. To be fair, with how basic the gameplay is I'm not sure how they could have varied it more, but I definitely would have appreciated it. 

Third, the bosses are kinda...simple, except the fourth, but that boss had a cheap-suicide attack, and the final which was really freaking cool.

Fourth, the chapters are too long(~2-4 hours each). I don't mind the length of the game, I only think it should have been chopped up more into smaller chapters. Especially for when you want to complete everything, but screw up one single time and need to use a continue(which affects your chapter ranking) and really don't feel like reloading and repeating what you already did. 

They do give you plenty of save points, so if you don't care about the personal ranking and only about playing and the story, then you probably wouldn't mind most of my complaints.

Tl;Dr: If you want to learn more abut the story of danganronpa, are fine with the change in gameplay and don't mind rare occasions of frustration. then it's worth the ~€20 on sale, perhaps full price, but I'm a cheap f*** so I wouldn't.

edit: sidenote Steam says I spend ~18 hours on the game, but the in game save file says I've only played ~12-13 hours, but I'm assuming steam contains the more realistic number of played hours.

38635851.review:
I feel like this game is essential for people who are well into danganronpa story. 
There are things this game has to offer that other games nor anime covered.
-Seeing up close the state of the outside world.
-Getting to know Makoto's sister.
-Finding out the fate of captives from danganronpa 1. Like younger brother of Aoi Asahina.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
This game is totally different compared to the previous ones.
+ It's fully 3D!
+ Like 98% of all dialogues are voiced in english. No more reading ~ 
+ We get to play as 2 characters! Genocide Jack and Komaru Naegi.
+ Fighting monokumas with a hacking gun. 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
This game is also shorter compared to others, like by a half. 
It's worth mentioning though that this game has a reply value. That's because you get graded based on how well you do in each chapter, there are collectables, and you can change difficulty level. On top of that there are challenges too.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I can't reccomend it if you aren't a fan of danganronpa. The game itself isn't mind blowing, but there are people who will appreciate it.

38611487.review:
[h1][b] 팬게임으로는 훌륭,  액션게임으로는 글쎄..? 	[/b][/h1]

*플레이 타임은 약 10시간 정도입니다.

*시리즈 최초 한글화가 되었습니다!
 
스파이크 춘 소프트 웨어의 유명 시리즈 단간론파 시리즈의 키보가미네 학원 3부작의 외전입니다.

단간론파 1과 2 사이의 시간대를 다루고 있고, 단간론파 1의 주인공, 나에기 마코토의 동생 나에기 코마루가 주인공입니다.

주인공 나에기 코마루는 자칭, 타칭 '평범한 여고생' 이고, 모종의 이유로 토와 시티에 1년동안 감금되었다가, 모노쿠마의 습격으로

토와시티를 탈출하다가 '후카와 토코'를 만나게 되면서 이야기를 시작합니다.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


단간론파 1,2의 외전격이다 보니까 처음 입문하시는 분에게는 스토리가 전부 이해가지 않고, 떡밥도 모를 수 밖에 없습니다.



또한 시리즈 최초로, 3D 슈팅게임으로 나온 게임인데,  애초에 슈팅게임을 만들던 회사가 아니라 그런지 상당히 조작감이 떨어집니다.


 게다가 시리즈 전통인 '학급재판'을 삭제하고 퍼즐 요소를 넣었는데  주인공의 말을 빌리면 '또 이 기계야?' 라는 말이 나올 정도로 어디선가 본 거 같은, 반복요소가 심한 퍼즐입니다.


그래픽도 비타에서 이식한 그래픽인데, 가끔 나오는 3D 컷씬과 인게임 그래픽은 빈말로도 좋다고는 못할 정도로 구립니다.


하지만 이 모든 단점을 뒤집는 것이 '스토리'와 '캐릭터성' 입니다.


단간론파 시리즈답게 마지막에 반전이 엄청난 스토리로, 앞에 서술한 단점을 모두 뒤집어버릴 정도의 스토리입니다. 초,중반에는 심심할 수 있지만 후반부터 떡밥들을 하나 둘 씩 풀면서 재밌어지는 스토리가 일품입니다. 

또한 주인공과 후카와 토코의 귀여움과 전작에서 나왔던 사건들과 연관된 요소들은 스토리와 함께 이 게임의 큰 장점이네요.

추가로 단간론파 1부터 이어지는 처형때 나오는 2.5D의 컷씬은 여전히 좋습니다.


[h1][b] 총평	[/b][/h1]



[h1]장점[/h1]

- 뛰어난 스토리

- 팬서비스 게임으로써 훌륭한 외전격 작품

- 훌륭한 캐릭터성

- 처형 때 나오는 2.5D 컷씬

[h1]단점[/h1]

-비타판 이식이라 좋지 않은 그래픽

- 전작을 하지 않은 사람에게는 불친절한 스토리

- 좋지 않은 3D 슈팅 조작감

- 일본 게임 특유의 오글거림

- 반복적인 게임플레이

-3D 컷씬.


[h1][b] 평점[/b][/h1]


[h1] 7/10 [/h1]

+ 단간론파 시리즈 답게 스포를 당하면 재미가 엄청나게 반감 당합니다. 조심하세요!

절대절망소녀를 플레이하면서 퍼즐 요소가 전작들 보다 더 쉽고 단조로운 편이라 퍼즐을 깨는 맛이 부족하여 게임의 재미가 떨어진다고 느꼈었지만, 단간론파 시리즈 특유의 흥미진진하고 숨막히는 스토리 전개와 개성넘치는 캐릭터들, 그리고 그 스토리와 캐릭터들이 품고 있는 상징과 의미 하나 하나가 강렬하여 절대절망소녀에서 손을 땔 수 없었습니다. 그리고 절대절망소녀는 단간론파 시리즈들 간의 스토리 연결을 도우는 역할을 하고 있어, 전작을 플레이 및 시청한 저에게 매우 흥미로운 게임이었습니다. 또한 기존 단간론파 학급재판식이 아닌, FPS 액션 형식의 느낌도 단간론파에 대한 색다른 경험이였습니다. 특유의 배경, BGM 등도 강렬한 인상을 남겨주기에 충분했습니다.

정말 멋진 게임이였습니다.

38266680.review:
Słusznie w tytule jest zaznaczone, że to "inna Danganronpa", bo faktycznie tak jest. Tym razem nie ścieramy się na polu umysłowym i nie rozwiązujemy zagadek morderstw, ale chwytamy za megaf... to jest za działko hakujące i wycinamy sobie drogę przez setki monokum.

Brzmi jakby gra nie była zupełnie powiązana z poprzednimi, ale tak zupełnie nie jest. "Another Episode" to genialne wręcz nawiązanie do serii i choć wielu bohaterów jest nowych (w tym nasza protagonistka Komaru), to smaczki są widoczne tu i tam. Najbardziej chyba podobało się mi zestawienie postaci Komaru - typowej dla serii "absolutnie normalnej" głównej bohaterki - z Toko. Brzmi to jak przepis na katastrofę, ale obserwowanie jak dziewczyny dojrzewają (każda na swój sposób) było bardzo interesujące. Gorzej niestety wypadli wrogowie - dzieci są po prostu irytujące, a Kurokuma ma tak durnowaty głos, że nie mogłam do niego czuć nic prócz żałości. Dużym plusem okazała się jednak obecność [spoiler]Nagita, a pod koniec także Kumukury.[/spoiler]

Pod względem klimatu jest to chyba najbardziej "dangaronpowa" gra. Tragizm wydarzeń miesza się tu z komizmem monokum, fantazjami Toko na temat Byakui (najlepsza część fabuły!), psychodelicznymi kolorami, azjatyckim popem, okrutnie nachalnym fanserwisem i - w ogólności - ogromnym dystansem do japońskiej popkultury. 

Do grafiki trzeba się chwilę poprzyzywczajać, bo modele postaci sprawiają wrażenie nieco przestarzałych i "wyblakłych". Muzyka jak zwykle wypada świetnie, za to kamera mogłaby pracować zdecydowanie lepiej, bo wielokrotnie w trybiue celowania muszka działka nagle lądowała na suficie, a nie na szarżującym na mnie monokumie. "Another Episode" nie jest zbyt trudną strzelanką, ale wymaga tam, gdzie wymagać musi. Dla mnie dużym plusem były zagadki logiczne.

"Ultra Despair Gilrs" jest dobrą grą - w innej konwencji niż pozostałe "Danganronpy", ale nadal świetnie rozubudowuje historię. Jest to jednak tytuł tylko dla fanów - pozostali mogą poczuć się odrzuceni przez bardzo specyficzny humor. Ale tym polecam zagrać w poprzednie tytuły, by go pojęli.

38167535.review:
Allright, this is a true gem. There are some cons but no breaking ones.

So, what do you get here ? A very very good action game I must say. Controls answer quite perfectly, only had some camera  problems mainly while too many monokumas chasing me and whit the final boss. 

If you have played Danganronpa 1 and 2, then you will love this game. If you haven't, well, you'll still like it but will miss most of the references it makes to the two previous very very good installments. 

I must say I bought it blindly because of the label "danganronpa". And I honestly fell in love with that duo of girls. Playing Genocide Jack was very clever from Spike Chunsoft and Makoto Naegi's little sister is a lovelly character. Like always this is so well written, the scenario is always clever and if the plot is still the same, the end is always something epic. If you played both previous danganronpa you know how the final shot looks like and you know this game (if you have finished it) does it right too. I'm now going to attack Danganronpa 3, Don't know what I'll get for hope and despair but this neverending struggle is so well brought on the scene by the developper that I am always amazed.. Or I have a talent to be impressed every single time I see the same thing... Ha, isn't that hope for you ? Hahahaha... 

So Please jump in, take up the role of Komaru and Toko and enjoy. Like all the other episodes of the series, it can be sometimes a bit long, repetitive but the puzzles here are clever, most of them are easy but it does fit the childish mood of the enemies and not a bad point at all.

I truly had a great time with this and won't miss the opportunity to play it another time...someday... someyear... I like the way they implement characters from the first game into the other ones. 

Have fun guys, this game deserve the time you'll put in it.

38063078.review:
起動が出来ない問題について

ランチャーから起動すると読み込み中にエラー落ちしていましたが
サポートにメールをして原因を調べてもらい、サウンドの初期化中に問題がある事が分かりました。
自分はサウンド設定が192000Hzですが、現在48000hz以上に対応しておらず、それが原因で落ちています。

他のゲームでも、たまーにある事ですね。
サウンド設定を48000hzにしたら無事にタイトル画面までいけました。

同じ症状の方がいたらサウンド設定で48000Hzにすればプレイ出来ると思います。
他の原因もスレッドにあるので(解決策あり)絶対にこれで治るとは言い切れません。

サポートにメールで48000Hz以上は対応出来るか？と聞いたところ。

>>「サウンド設定の48000Hz以上への対応」の件につきまして、調査を行い対応が可能であれば修正対応を行わせて頂きます。
>>ご不便をおかけいたしますが、現在は早急な対応は難しい状況となりますので、音質設定変更にてプレイして頂くようお願い申し上げます。

との事ですので、一先ずは48000Hzでプレイしましょう。

37756535.review:
When I heard that Danganronpa was going to have a shooter spinoff, I immediately thought this was a sure disaster. But I came to play anyway because I'm a fan of the franchise. I have to say I'm pleasantly surprised, and I would recommend this game to anyone who also likes Danganronpa.

Don't get me wrong, the gameplay is really mediocre. I note that I played on the hardest difficulty. Most Monokumas die in a single hit, and are so slow that you basically have to be trying to be hit. It's almost impossible to run out of bullets. The puzzles are in general fairly simple. Even most bosses die in two hits, which is just plain ridiculous and means that most boss fights are over before they even start (a shame, because I really liked the boss soundtrack).

But if you like Danganronpa, you probably don't like it for the gameplay, and you definitely don't play it for Improved Hangman's Gambit. You play it for the story, which while not nearly as good as the ones in the visual novels was still good enough to keep me interested for the full duration of the game. Komaru and Toko's relationship is interesting and the extra backstory on the DR universe is very welcomed. I found myself collecting optional items just to get extra lines of dialogue, which is something I usually do not do. The OST is still very good, so that's an extra plus.

Despite that, the writing/story/characters/OST make up for it fully in my opinion. I think these are the whole experience.  I really appreciate how it still feels like a wholesome Danganronpa experience, despite being completely unlike the rest of the series.

37623230.review:
As a big fan of the Danganronpa franchise, I was skeptical about the sudden genre change in Despair Girls, but bought the game to get more details about the story & its characters, as Ultra Despair Girls takes place between Trigger Happy Havoc and Goodbye Despair. I was disappointed on all accounts.

The gameplay consists of 3 main parts: running around shooting Monokumas, solving puzzles, and solving riddles. The puzzles are incredibly simple, and you are given obvious hints about how to solve it. You can also ignore the entire puzzle aspect and shoot your way through it, which often times is an even easier option due to the poor puzzle design. It feels tedious, and you get no sense of accomplishment from completing these. The riddles feel out of place and strangely difficult in an action-based game. The combat is uninspired and easy, the controls are difficult. You are given the option to use Genocide Jack as a power up in combat, but the game is so easy that I never used it once. 

As for the plot, you will learn nothing about the characters from the other games, besides a slight backstory for Komaeda. Throughout the game, there are odd times where the characters break the fourth wall, acting out of character for no reason other than for the developers and writers to poke fun at themselves, as if they made a fantastic game that they deserve attention for. You know when Joss Whedon took over the second Avengers, and everyone started making nerdy jokes for no reason? It's like that.

Skip this game, and read a plot summary on Wikipedia or something instead.

TLDR: Boring, uninspired gameplay with a boring plot that offers no details about the characters players have come to love.

36671334.review:
首先说明，我是弹丸12都玩了两遍的系列老粉丝，这个评论是从一个粉丝角度说的。这个不推荐并非因为我对该作有多么失望，只是个人眼中这部作品综合质量确实一般，实在无法给个推荐。然而steam的评价机制并没有个中间项，只好给个不推荐了。

个人认为这部作品的评价重点主要在3个地方，TPS、解谜、剧情。其中TPS方面这款游戏的表现绝对不能说好，甚至可以说相当的烂。言弹系统虽然也有其独创性，但是实在无法弥补其射击手感差、敌人设计一般等严重问题。解谜方面也完全不尽人意，谜题难度非常简单，而且量也不多，对于玩过弹丸12的玩家，这种谜题完全没法让人爽到。

这代唯一的加分项就在剧情了，然而就这个加分项也存在一些问题。这作剧情的最精华部分主要在最后，虽然最后的剧情确实不错，但是前期剧情看点仅仅只有二人的心境的变化与成长。这导致大半以上的游戏时间玩家需要用并不惊艳的剧情搭配并不优秀的游戏性进行游玩，游戏体验确实不能算很好。

总的来说，如果你没接触过弹丸系列，这款游戏并不推荐购买，对非粉丝这个价格实在不划算；但是对于没接触过弹丸却喜欢解谜推理游戏，那强烈推荐弹丸论破1和2，两步正传是绝对超值的作品，这部就先放一放；对于弹丸系列的老玩家，也最好稍微考虑下，该作的剧情只是对正传做了一些补充，对于系列粉丝，这些剧情实际上只是锦上添花，不知道也无伤大雅。 [b]如果能接受我上面提到的缺点并且是系列真爱，那还是买吧[/b]，毕竟88块钱对真正喜爱这个系列的人来说不是问题。

36634503.review:
TL:DR - Fun game which runs smoothly and has some nice humor and mystery to it. Get it if you are a fan of the series.

+ Runs smoothly
+ English & Japanese voices
+ Fun
+ Puzzles

I really enjoyed this, when I first played it I couldn't put it down. I loved the gameplay and wanted to learn more of what was happening.
It helps develop and explain parts of the series I didn't expect them to touch on but was great they did in this way. 
The models look great for the series and I actually enjoyed the English voices and the backgrounds are fitting.

The puzzles I enjoyed, some were simple, others did have me thinking on if it was a trick or if I was just stupid.


- Forced tutorials when replaying chapters
- Monoku-man arcade challenges
- Tracking items you missed


Everytime you replay a chapter (such as for missing collectables/A ranking) you are told the tutorials again, as well as what each upgrade does. This is annoying, game you know I already completed the game, so quit it with the tutorials. Yes they can be skipped but that is still some time taking me out of the gameplay to spam skip it.

The arcade challenges are easy but some are a pain in the ass to get right, either 2-3 monokuma's take their time to get where they should be or you were caught for bullshit reasons. Chapter 4 I HATE because of this, 2-3 of those challenges are a bit of a trek from any save-point and to get A ranking you need to perfect the challenges, you can retry them and keep your A rank score but retrying over and over will lower that chapter score.
Those Monokuma beasts can go to hell for all I care >_>
But this is more of a nitpick, I wouldn't have an issue with it if a save point was actually near the damn things but this is my 100% side talking.

Lastly, if you want to 100% it, you may need to use a guide. The chapters do not tell you what or how many of each collectable you missed other than the hidden children. Otherwise you need to guess and hope while replaying a chapter you find what you are missing, otherwise have fun being in the dark. I admit I used a guide after I completed the game a first time to tick off what I had found so I knew which chapters I had to return to to save myself time.


Overall you be getting around 20 hours of gameplay for your purchase, possibly 24 to 100% without using a guide.

36387330.review:
It's, uh, a video game.
You get at least ten hours out of it, but there just isn't difficulty due to mouse aiming on a game designed for PS Vita, even on the hardest difficulty. It's an alright time waster though.
The puzzles are nothing spectacular, gameplay is simple but works, bossfights are alright, but the chances are you want to play it because it's Danganronpa. It's a whole different genre altogether.
Also, to understand its existence, you'll need to go through both DR1 and SDR2 which is roughly 45-50 hours (spoilers are included).
Visually it's nothing spectacular, you can clearly see how it's a Vita game, but requires DirectX 11 regardless.
There is the problem of mouse acceleration which I didn't figure out, but did it regardless with ease. Dying is practically impossible outside of explosions throwing you off an edge[spoiler] which happened to me twice, embarrassingly enough[/spoiler].
You are littered with ammunition pickups, and you don't really need to rely on Genocider Syo's abilities at all.
Soundtrack is, once again, pretty good. 
Don't worry, it also has something to do with Junko, as with every other piece of DR media.
As a game it's just nothing special.
I can't really say anything other than "Probably worth something if you like DR in general", be it your time or money, or maybe both.

36354386.review:
[h1]PROS:[/h1]
- Jogabilidade relativamente fácil para iniciantes.

- Sequência direta de DanganRonpa 1, predecessor de Super Dangan 2.

- História interessante e, em partes, bem obscura. Aproximadamente 11 horas de cutscenes que dificilmente você vai querer pular. Há trechos em formato de anime.

- O "diferentão" da franquia, partindo pra uma jogabilidade mais voltada à ação.

- Apesar de single player, pode ser bem divertido e pode prender o jogador pela história.

- Personagens principais carismáticos.

- Para quem gosta de achievements, há bons guias disponíveis na comunidade o que torna fácil a coleta de todos os ítens pelo jogo, assim como torna fácil platinar o game.

- Embora mais orientado a TPS, Ultra Despair Girls carrega os elementos originais de DanganRonpa que fazem a franquia ser positivamente especial do jeito que ela é para o seu público alvo.

[h1]Contras:[/h1]
- Falta de maior imersão em outros modos de jogo após zerar a main story, para os que desejam mais ou estão mutualmente acostumados com jogos multiplayers.

- Compatibilidade para alguns controles-joysticks podem não funcionar, diferente dos outros jogos da franquia, tornando o uso do teclado e mouse a única opção.

- Preço salgado se for comprado fora de promoção.

- Alguns elementos da franquia, se tratando de roteiro, foram reciclados (não darei spoilers), ao invés de partir para um roteiro mais original. Porém para quem é fã da série, vai curtir de qualquer forma.

[b]Nota final 9/10.[/b]

Quando lançado, achei que seria um erro partir pra um modo de ação dentro de uma franquia investigativa, porém o jogo na verdade é, como um todo, divertido. Recomendo absolutamente para quem é fã da série, e recomendo aos que são marinheiros de primeira viagem comprar o primeiro (Danganronpa Trigger Happy Havoc) antes.

36298445.review:
I've been reluctant to try this game for quite a while. It deviates from the usual Danganronpa formula and goes in the direction of a third-person shooter.

If I were to describe this game , it would be a [i]tactical[i] story-driven third-person shooter.

Starting off with the graphics , the psycho-pop aesthetic really shows in this game and honestly the environments are quite memorable. Sometimes the lighting looks off and the models seem bland , but it's not a massive concern. As always , the execution cutscenes have a very distinct art-style , inspiring anxiety within the player. There are also some enjoyable animated cutscenes.

There are executions in this game , but overall they are a lot more tame.

The story is far from perfect , falling flat on many occasions. First off , there is very little character development apart from the two main characters (Komaru and Toko). I wish that some of the characters were explored in a bit more detail (for example [spoiler]Hagakure's mother[/spoiler] or any of the 'Warriors of Hope'). Backstories seemed a little sloppy , in the sense that they weren't explained extremely well. You are only really given the general idea of why the 'Warriors of Hope' are extremely delusional. I'm not going to spoil anything , as even the first couple of scenes are worth going into blind.
For me , the game gives me the opposite impression of what Danganronpa V3 did. The story fell flat , but I really liked the ending. Apart from the dumb hope shtick that keeps resurfacing , the ending definitely gave a lot of closure and detail to the game.

The gameplay is surprisingly good , consisting of the player choosing different 'truth bullets' to counter different enemies. I very much liked the puzzles where you had to 'destroy all the enemies in one explosion' or 'find the child without being caught'. The 'puzzle shooter' element of the game really goes with the Danganronpa aesthetic. That being said , sometimes you have to shoot through waves of enemies , which gets rather repetitive as the game progresses.
Rather than a head-shot , you've got an eye-shot , which one-shots a normal monokuma. The bossfights in this game are rather good. Most consist of a large boss , which you have to find a weakness somewhere on the body , whether it is their eye , torso or leg. The boss fights are very enjoyable , and not extremely difficult.

Overall , the game does feel like a Danganronpa game , but for the most part it did feel like watching an above-average filler episode of seomthing. Suffice to say , if you're interested in the Danganronpa universe , it's a must-buy. If you're looking to play your first Danganronpa game , not this one. I give it a solid 6.5/10.

36287394.review:
《弹丸论破：绝对绝望少女》是Spike Chunsoft在2014年9月25日原本在psv平台发布的一款tps游戏，后来在2017年移植到pc平台。本作是一代15人校园杀戮结束后二代时间线之前的外传作品，讲述了那场人类最恶绝望事件的来龙去脉，填补了2篇正传的剧情空白。本作的女主人公是一代苗木诚的妹妹苗木困，她在本次的绝望事件中被卷入。同时，一代和二代的一些人物也会在游戏中登场。

剧情的开始，苗木妹作为一名普通女高中生，没有任何突出的才能，被监禁在公寓里长达2年之久，日常饮食和衣物的更换都是通过输送口来获取，但在某日，黑白熊袭击了这座城市，苗木妹在黑白熊的追杀下偶然遇见了未来机构的十神，并获得了一把能够击杀黑白熊的骇客枪。后来在逃离过程中，被一群小孩抓住带回空中基地并被迫戴上了炸弹手镯，那群自称战士的小孩要她参加所谓的游戏并将她空投到地面，一场关乎存亡的残酷生存游戏开始了。

接下来苗木妹就会遇见游戏的第二个女主角，腐川冬子，一代被成为超高校级的文学少女的少女，同样隶属于未来机构，为了解救被抓住的十神而来。她们两个在一起经常发生一些奇怪的化学变化，起初的苗木妹十分单纯，是个遇见点大事情都想逃避并哭着喊欧尼酱的小女生，这点经常遭到腐川的吐槽。但是随着剧情的发展，冒险之间互相的帮助也使两人的关系密切起来，苗木妹不再软弱，变得坚强；腐川也不再冷漠无情，世事不问，在最后她们成为了真正的生死朋友。在笔者看来，这样的变化是积极的，向上的，我们现实也应该这样，互相理解互相改变，感情才能加深。（貌似往奇怪的地方发展了）

游戏的基本玩法为tps类型，但射击手感一般，不是追求射击杀戮快感的游戏，其带有大量解谜内容才是游戏主菜。骇客枪开始只有一种破坏弹和强制启动弹，随着流程的推进，玩家可以拿到多种骇客弹。冒险中玩家可以发现一些游戏厅，游戏厅过关有一定要求，基本都是要求玩家一次性击杀所有敌人。在被多个敌人包围时候，玩家可以消耗电池电量启动终结技能，切换出杀戮者翔，其不受伤害和高dps可以瞬间将范围内的敌人尽数剿灭。

PC版是原来psv版移植而来，以PC强大的硬件性能，玩家能将游戏开到非常高的分辨率，同时，pc版ui也相应地对高分辨率做了优化处理，相比一些日厂原封不动地暴力移植（说你呢暗耻），算是十分良心了。PC版除了支持手柄外，也支持键鼠操作，但是对于一款原生psv游戏来说，使用键鼠游戏难度会大大下降，要说游戏的敌人在psv手柄操作下还有点威胁，在pc键鼠的环境下好比残障儿童，没有半点威胁，对于追求难度的玩家这里笔者推荐游戏选择高难度或者使用手柄游玩。

在困难的磨练下，人会逐渐蜕去稚气，逐渐老练、沉稳，并勇于担当。苗木妹就是个经典例子，由极其平凡甚至被小孩们称作量产型号的普通女高中生变成一个拯救城市的希望，在15小时的游玩时长里，玩家可以见证她的成长，就算在困难和绝望面前一次次跌倒，在她自己和朋友的帮助下，克服恐惧，勇于承担。人生也是如此，所以笔者引用一部电影的名字——绝望苦短，少女前行吧！

优点：
+角色刻画丰满
+剧情填补空白
+解谜要素有趣味
+支持中文

缺点：
-射击手感一般

总结：粉丝向作品，不乏趣味，建议在一代和二代游戏之后游玩，否则很多剧情都搞不懂。
图文版：[url=http://www.gimmgimm.com/article/info?id=11757]绝望苦短，少女前行吧！[/url]

36286332.review:
Initially, I hate this game. I felt like refunding it with the weird 3d graphics and the shift in the genre. I decided to play it til' the end, and honestly, I'd say it was worth it.
Danganronpa Ultra Despair Girls is an awful lot like super paper mario; the gameplay itself wasn't anything stellar (and I'm a little biased, because I really liked the class trials from Danganronpa 1 & 2), but the story was alright. Unlike super paper mario, this game has an aesthetic that is rather displeasant in my eyes. 
From early game to end game, I felt like the game didn't have that much of a challenge while playing on normal mode. I've only died about 3 times in the game, and that was around mid-to-end game. I think it would be better to play on the easy mode, but if you want to actually be challenged, I'd think the hard mode would suffice (I haven't tested either one, sorry!)

In short; Danganronpa Ultra Despair Girls isn't like the other games in the series, but it's still Danganronpa. It doesn't really have writing as good as the other games, mainly because of the shift towards third-person action (with a dash of puzzles)[spoiler][strike](and worst of all, there isn't class trials!)[/strike][/spoiler]. But when it comes down to it, if you liked the other games and want more Danganronpa, this is for you.

35959814.review:
I played this game because I heard that it was mandatory for story in Dangan Ronpa 3. The third-person shooter gameplay didn’t seem up my alley and I read reviews that the main character was not good and Toko, well, she was unpleasant to listen to in the first game. So needless to say, I went into this game only for the story and expected to suffer for it. 20 hours later, I can say that, despite its flaws, I was pleasantly surprised that I enjoyed the game. I’m gonna keep this spoiler-free since I’m as antsy about these things as the next guy, so I’m gonna try to give you a better idea of what to expect. Also, the game takes place in between Dangan Ronpa 1 and 2 (a 1.5 of sorts), so you gotta play those two first.
Obviously going over the story would be a spoiler, but I will say that throughout the game I was unimpressed with the plot itself. It wasn’t bad, just not too interesting, which is curious given the interesting premise of the first game is what got us all here. The kind of “smaller” plot of exploring the city and going from point to point was entertaining enough, though. As for the characters, there was only one I outright didn’t like. The other antagonists then varied from good to “eh, sure” at worst. The two protagonists that you spend the most time with, Komaru and Toko, are interesting. I started losing my patience with character rituals they went through, even if they made sense given the horrid situation. Komaru is scared, Toko is mean. However, around halfway through, both, (even Toko) grew on me until the end. The rest of the supporting cast is pretty alright, but the game doesn’t really focus on them anyways so no big worries.
I think a big problem I have with this game is its environment. The SETTING and places you explore are fine if you don’t mind a ruined city setting like me, but the places you’re actually walking through are lacking. Dangan Ronpa tends to have a minimalist style where things are flat and drawn oddly, and this works when they’re presented as a scene in front of you like in the first games. But you’re actually walking around these areas in 3D space in this game, so those setpieces seem very off. Not all environments are like this thankfully, but when it happens with stuff like fire, it stands out. My least favorite part is the people that are tertiary characters are all blue/purple. This trick works in super crowded areas like midday Tokyo, but even the most crowded area in the game wasn’t enough to justify it. I would’ve taken 3 or 4 of the same human model copy-pasted over this. When these people were dead everywhere, the impact was COMPLETELY lost because they were a vibrant blue/purple that tried the opposite of seeming real. It took me out of the gravity of dead people being EVERYWHERE, which in turn made the characters seem melodramatic even if they actually weren’t. Plus, your character ends up getting stuck on geometry corners quite a bit.
As for the gameplay itself, it’s fine. I can respect them wanting to try something new, and for the different plot this game has, it definitely works. Normally you’d think you’re shooting down Monokumas a bunch, but this game has a semi-surprising small amount of fights. I mean, it IS a Dangan Ronpa game, so it’s focus is on the story and dialogue. Like the first games, the “gameplay” aspect is really meant to connect these story points. That makes them sound empty, which they’re not, but there seemed to be more puzzles than Monokumas. Anyone wanting to play this to shoot things may be disappointed; no fight with Monokumas felt difficult. I may even recommend doing Hard. You’re given a myriad of bullet types, but I found myself only ever using the default since I didn’t need much else except when the game put in something that needed them. In fact, a good chunk of the game is surprisingly puzzle-based, using different bullet types to usually kill all Monokumas in an area in one shot. Thankfully you don’t HAVE to do this the “right” way and the grade you get from them isn’t important due to the easy difficulty, but I found myself hating these because Monokumas mostly ended up behaving stupidly and messing it up even though I knew the solution (a la an explosion just barely missing one). Upgrades were no only weird, but didn’t feel too helpful. As a result, collecting money to buy them didn’t feel too necessary. Also, it cannot go without saying that the game doesn’t tell you there’s a run button and, on keyboard (which you probably should be playing for aiming), it’s on SHIFT. I found Shift to be endlessly uncomfortable…but the only way to rebind it was to use an external program, so be advised.
Overall, this game was a roller coaster. I went in dreading it, ended up excited to play by the end of the first hour, grew fatigued several more hours in, got interested again halfway through, started to fade again, then it brought me back near the end. It’s not perfect by any means. The gameplay is rough around the edges, but can still be satisfying and a breath of fresh air for the series. The story and Komaru/Toko can start to feel stale, but get built on enough to not get too bad and ultimately become enjoyable. I could see where people would think it’s not good, but I would play it to continue the Dangan Ronpa story regardless. But even then, I think it has its own merits that make it more than a mere stepping stone to get to Dangan Ronpa 3. I left out a good amount of detail to stay spoiler-free, so I'd recommend seeing for yourself!

35814157.review:
Ultra Despair girls is a great game for Danganronpa fans.
While it takes the danganronpa series in a new direction with [b]completely[/b] different gameplay, it still feels very much just like Danganronpa. In fact, it feels more Danganronpa than previous titles have ever been. Danganronpa is known for its coined "psychopop" theme/aesthetic and i feel this game takes the aspects of psychopop to the max. The game is pretty dark, argugably darker than previous danganronpa titles. One would be accurate to assume that a game that involves children would tone down the madness, right? Wrong, in fact adding children to the mix contributes to the madness, giving the game a much darker theme than the last ones while simultaneously maintaining the humor. Ironically, there are several dirty jokes to be seen in the game as well. A few references to other media. 
I reccomend picking up every collectable item that appears in the game. There are interesting stories behind them all. In fact, if you really are interested in the story of the game, its critical that you pick up the items you find while exploring the game, because details about the story and characters are revealed.
Gameplay wise, there ARE no debates. I felt like this was going to be something like a deal breaker for me, but i was wrong. I found myself enjoying the game nonetheless. There are a lot of twists and turns in the game like previous titles. However, this game is full of revelations. Some won't be as exciting if you've never played the first two games, especially the first one. But you don't' really have to play the first two to enjoy it.
The game is a third person shooter. Unlike most shoot-to-kill games, you actually have to use specific kind of bullets for certain enemies. The Ai is surprisingly dumb sometimes, but the boss battles can feel a little cheap, especially the final one. There are also special challenges that reward you based on your strategic methods. There are a few riddles, most pretty easy, one dissapointingly easy. 
Debates are replaced with boss battles. Each boss has a story, which actually compensates for the murders and motives that were in previous games. I found myself looking forward to boss battles just as much as i looked forward to the debates.

I really didn't think I'd like this game; shooters aren't really my thing, and the fact there were no murder trails left me a little upset at first. However, now that I've finished it in three days? I can happily say my mind has been fully changed. 

If you're a fan of the series, please, buy this! The change of pace, while jarring at first, can be offputting, but this game definitely has its own charm. It will most likely not be for everyone, and while I personally didn't come across any problems nor did I find the experience boring at any point, I know many others could have lists of cons with this game. However, if you like character development, you'll like this. Toko and Komaru's relationship blooms so nicely and I've fallen for both girls, really. Byakuya, who? Get me in with this yuri instead!

All jokes aside, while people may find the gamepay boring, the story is rich and the cutscenes are very well done. Plus, it has psycho kids that ACTUALLY act like lil kids. What's not to love about that?! Overall, I'd give this game a 9/10.

I love Danganronpa. This game has a good story, and ties in with the rest of the series very well. Playing through it, you can't help but admire the work that went into creating the despair-filled world of the Danganronpa series for you to walk through and experience. 

However, the gameplay itself is utterly unbearable, just grinding your way through dull Monokumas. Granted, you can run right past most of them, especially the 'tough' ones... 
I really liked this game, but I can't claim to have had any fun playing it. They should've used a different medium to tell this story. While I am giving this a positive review, I think most people would be better off just watching someone else play through it, rather than trudge through the levels themselves.

35284963.review:
You get Toko Fukawa from Trigger Happy Havoc and Makoto's sister from the flashback way early in the same game, then put them as protagonists in a third-person shooter. What would sound like a disaster ends up becoming the single most Danganronpish Danganronpa game you could possibly imagine.

"Oh, but there are no trials", I used to tell myself. "Oh, but you don't investigate murders", I told myself as well, as if to discourage myself to play this. As it turns out, the essence of Danganronpa goes beyond that and what you get from this spin-off is a pure brand new Danganronpa game. The whole psychopop universe is there, returning characters are still the same (and still developing as characters) and brand new characters will pop into the tale and enrich the plot in a very visual novel fashion despite the genre shift. In fact, Ultra Despair Girls is just as story-heavy as every other game in the series.

If you finished the first two games and ever even remotely liked Danganronpa, getting UDG is a duty.

35227926.review:
Danganronpa Another Episode can at times feel like an unneeded spin-off title. Changes in gameplay and presentation could be offputting to fans. It's quite hard to deny as well that gameplay is very clunky. Controls are manageable on pc, making this port an excellent way to play. Unfortunately, level design and even gameplay itself end up feeling mediocre.

You will never run out of ammo. The puzzle rooms end up as wasted potential and there’s a level of polish in mechanics which Despair Girls sorely lacks. However just with classic Danganronpa, the story is incredibly compelling if a little cliché this time. The setting and atmosphere is brutal. It’s not an original story by any means, but has its own unique take on the duo protagonist stereotype; And it gives Toko the character development she needed.

Since there isn’t any kind of middle ground, it gets a recommendation. The game is functional and the story will keep you invested if you’re a fan already. Try it if you want something more from the series, the story is good enough to hold this game up on its own. But for newcomers? This isn’t something that’s going to be for you.

35193492.review:
At first, I thought I wouldn't be able to recommend this game. However, I ended up enjoying it way more than I had expected (even thought it was inferior compared to the franchise previous games). Honestly, there are more Cons than Pros, but I still think it is worth playing. 

Pros:

It's Danganronpa, with Danganronpa characters. It's funny and inspiring as usual, just like the previous games. 

The characters, althought not so well developed, are likeable and cool. I did hate Komaru and Touko through the whole first chapter, but they grew on me later on. Some other characters did the same.

It completes the previous games. The story is pretty cool, and so is it's setting. It does well its job of being the link between DR1 and DR2. 

We have voices all the time! Unlike the previous games, everytime someone says something, we can read it AND hear it! Amazing. The seiyuus did an amazing job as well (I played it with the audio in Japanese). 

Cons:
The FPS is terrible - sometimes I would aim right and miss, or try to shoot something that was too far away and the shoot would miss even if I COULD SEE it hit the target -, so be warned. As bad as it is, however, somehow you get used to it at some point.
 
The character development isn't as good as DR1 and DR2. You spend a lot of time shooting Monokumas and running around, so there isn't much time to talk. Some characters can still be great - but you still feel like you wanted to see more of them. 

Some bosses are just [i]terrible[/i]. I could say the whole boss concept was terrible, but sometimes it was fun fighting against them, so I'm just gonna say that some are terrible. Like the last one. Seriously, wtf was that?

Most puzzles are just... Boring. They're too simple or simply bad executed. I don't know. Tbh I think I only liked ONE in the entire game. 

That's it, I guess. I still strongly recommend you play this game so you get to know the characters and more of the Danganronpa world.

35017537.review:
This game was quite the disappointment. Danganronpa isn't known for their amazing gameplay. Danganronpa 1 and 2 could have been masterpieces, if you actually had to solve the murders like one would in real life, as opposed to solving it by playing minigames. Luckily, danganronpa makes up for that by having the most sickening, disgusting, incredible stories, making it still one of the best games I've played. 

Because of this weaker gameplay, I decided to play this game on normal instead of hard, so I'd spend less time doing that. This kinda... backfired because as bad as the gameplay was, it now became even more of a snoozefest. 

The game is some sort of shooter where you use different bullets for different occasions. A rather familiar concept. The opponents only don't really fight back so it doesn't really matter what you do. It becomes boring fast. In between the repetitive shooting, you get thrown into a game room time and time again, where you have to 'solve' a puzzle to unlock the door. Only the puzzles are incredibly dull and simple and require almost no thinking if at all. I say 'solve', because, as I later found out, you don't have to solve them at all. The room says: kill them all in one explosion.... buuut, it doesn't matter what you do. If you just do everything but use explosions, the door opens as well. 

Now, the storyline. The main thing about the game series. It took about 20 hours before it finally got... a bit interesting. At the end there were some interesting twists, but it still was a lot weaker than the other two... and having to choose the very same thing over and over (you literally got the choice to either do something or don't do something, and you got that choice like 10 times in a row with a few seconds in between) was really annoying. 

So. This was by far the weakest of the danganronpa games. I suppose if you have no expectations and are not familiar with the other two it could be enjoyable, but if you've played the other two this is a real disappointment.

Pretty decent game, its a 3rd person shooter unlike the previous games however its still set in the danganronpa universe that we all know and love, it does have some puzzles scattered throughout the levels to keep your brain occupied since there's no trials so that's good enough. The pc port is pretty decent, keyboard and mouse controls work well however the aiming isn't that great, even if you're good at shooters its not that easy to get perfect shots every time. There are a few issues overall like the game feels a bit unpolished sometimes and the boss fights are a bit of weak point if you ask me but the graphics are nice and it even has some proper anime cutscenes here and there. There's a lot of little collectibles you can get like lore stuff and extra things that give you more coins so you can unlock everything. The game is a lot shorter than the other games but it does one thing well and that is that it tells you what happened inbetween the first and second games and answers a lot of questions. Although one big issue I have is that there's a bit of a cliffhanger so that sucks, dunno if the tv show continues the story cause I haven't watched it yet but ya know if it does its all good but if not its a bit annoying. 

Overall its a cool little game, worth the play if you want to know some more stuff about danganronpa. Not a perfect game though, the levels are a bit barebones and  the gameplay is a bit weak, Genocide Jack is best girl again ofcourse. 7/10

I've already beaten this game on the PS Vita. However, I still bought it again on PC anyways to re-experience the story in the way it SHOULD be experienced: in glorious HD 60fps with a keyboard and mouse.

And I gotta say, hot damn. 

This game was MEANT to be played with a mouse and keyboard. All the controls and movements that were clunky on the Vita now feels like second nature. The gameplay is actually fun now, and many details that couldn't be seen on the small Vita screen are now in full HD glory to be appreciated all over again.

TLDR The PC version of UDG is hands down the definitive way to experience this game. Everything looks crisp and lifelike in 60fps, and the third person shooter gameplay is now very enjoyable. Get this game.

而光从剧情向游戏来看，这部作品可能同时也不适合所有喜欢剧情向游戏的大众。在没有接触过弹丸系列其他作品的前提下，这部“绝对绝望少女”的剧情很可能会使人一头雾水：“嗯？这怎么回事？发生什么了？XXX是谁？干什么的？我为什么要特么拿着一个大喇叭在大街上打一堆面相清奇还酷爱跳广场舞的熊？这一堆熊孩子是不是有点毛病？”因为并未接触过弹丸主线剧情的玩家并不了解事件的来龙去脉，不知道自相残杀的学院生活也不知道所谓人类史上最大最糟的绝望性事件，所以总是处在困惑中，并不能完完全全的投入并享受游戏的剧情。

而对于已经对弹丸足够了解和喜爱的粉丝玩家们来说，这是一部足够优秀的作品。作为系列的外传，“绝对绝望少女”填补了正作的故事剧情在时间轴上的空白期，在一个与“学院”无关的城市里演绎着平凡却努力的少女的故事，其中也不乏与正作剧情相连的部分。身为“仆役”的狛枝，朝日奈的弟弟，不二咲的父亲等人，都让玩着弹丸一路走来的我们感到亲切（恐怕尤其是狛枝？XD）。

总的来说是一部十分粉丝向的作品。粉丝们就不用说了，就算我说不要买，你也不会停下点击购买的右手。

至于从来没有听说过弹丸的路人们......快去买一二两代正作呀！V3也快要发售了，估计等你们一二两部通关了正好能跟这部外传一起买！（一次直接剁两只手XD）

再至于我本人.........反正我当时买来两晚上忍不住修仙通关了感觉贼舒服2333333

34852867.review:
本評論含有些許劇情透露，還未接觸過遊戲的玩家請酌量閱讀。


《Danganronpa : Ultra Despair Girls》（以下用中譯統稱為《絕對絕望少女》）是《Danganronpa》番外作品，故事從原本格局不大的十五名希望峰學園高中生自相殘殺校園生活，延伸至被絕望壟罩且瀕臨毀滅人類社會，本作在劇情方面延續一代結尾，同時銜接二代開頭，算是彌補時間軸的空洞，讓玩家能更了解整起『人類史上最大最惡絕望事件』的來龍去脈。玩家在遊戲內扮演的角色是【超平凡級的女子高中生】〝苗木困〞，她是初代男主角〝苗木誠〞的妹妹，沒有任何特殊才能，一開始就因為不明原因被囚禁一年半時間，好不容易經過【未來機關】協助要重獲自由，以小孩為首的黑白熊軍隊卻在這個時候引發暴動，逃脫不成反被一群自稱是【希望的戰士】（由五名問題兒童所創立的組織）帶回總部，聽他們解釋完所謂的遊戲規則後，普通女子高中生展開了驚心動魄的逃亡之旅。

遊戲開始後沒多久，玩家會碰見一作登場的重要角色【超高中級的文學少女】〝腐川冬子〞，就算是沒接觸過前作的玩家，也能深刻體驗到她那令人感到焦躁的性格，時不時就潑人冷水，不太接受別人好意，甚至視其他人為糞土，雖說這名角色各方面表現都不討人喜愛，但筆者算是還滿喜歡她的，腐川的個性全是因為對自己沒有信心，認為無故對陌生人示好的人肯定另有盤算。追根究柢，她有這種想法其實沒錯，『人心難測，人言可畏，面具底下的不一定是笑容』，比起某些將『我認為你是好人』、『我們是最好的朋友』、『他絕對不會背叛我』掛在嘴邊的樂觀人士，腐川對任何人不信任的個性，才是《Danganronpa》世界裡正常人該有的性格，喔對了，我有提過腐川還有雙重人格的設定嗎？


儘管《絕對絕望少女》被分類為動作射擊遊戲，實際玩起來的感覺更像是如《Portal 傳送門》般的解謎遊戲，玩家可以利用未來機關交付的【駭客槍】射出各式言彈擊退黑白熊，冒險途中還會發現設有遊戲機台的娛樂間，除了初始機台要求玩家在不被發現的情況下逃離醫院，其餘機台皆會要求玩家運用指定言彈組合，一口氣摧毀設置在場上的所有黑白熊，舉例來說，我們可以發射【跳舞言彈】在警報黑白熊身上吸引周遭黑白熊靠近，之後再朝著炸彈黑白熊發射【破壞言彈】，讓它自爆達成瞬間消滅所有敵人的條件。除此之外，駭客槍還能用來破解小孩設計的謎題，大部分的謎題不難解決，給予的提示非常大方，如果碰到無法解決的謎題（應該不存在），不要忘記多多利用【觀察言彈】尋找蛛絲馬跡喔！

先前提到腐川冬子擁有雙重人格設定，雖然不知道是怎樣的原理（感覺認真就輸了，文學少女的第二人格盡然是變態殺人魔），只要腐川陷入昏迷、打噴嚏、或是腦部遭受電擊，都會讓第二人格【屠殺者翔】顯現，並取得身體的使用權，屠殺者翔主要攻擊模式是以剪刀切斷敵人，玩起來酷似動作較不順暢的半調子無雙遊戲，持續砍殺敵人會累積右下角【鮮血狂歡】計量表，每累計一條計量表都會給予一把剪刀，消耗一把剪刀可以對單一目標使用必殺技，消耗三把剪刀則能同時對多名敵人施展必殺技。順帶一提，屠殺者翔完全不會受到攻擊傷害，簡單來說就是進入無敵模式，不過要特別注意的是，左上角的電池容量消耗到零，屠殺者翔就會變回腐川冬子，系統也會將操縱人物強制轉回至苗木困。


當劇情進行到一定程度，我們會發現成立【希望的戰士】組織的五名孩子都有不為人知的過去，父母沒有詢問孩子的意願，就因為一時本能衝動將孩子誕生在得不到幸福的家庭，他們被父母遺棄、虐待、性侵，被望子成龍的過時觀念逼迫必須捨棄童年，過著高壓統治的生活，就算是天真無邪的孩子，也會被成年人的醜惡汙染。曾經有位漫畫家寫過這段名言：『惡人也需要惡人的救世主』，相對地被視為【弱者】的孩子，只要有人施出關愛，他們就會直接認定對方是救世主，全心全意完成救世主的需求，強烈的仇恨會使他們認為某些特定族群全都是一丘之貉，需要全部殲滅才能滿足心中的恨意，這樣解釋或許就能讓大家理解，為何【希望的戰士】會如此憎恨大人，筆者並不認為他們的做法是錯誤的。

全世界都面臨少子化危機，畢竟養兒育女的權利，只有養得起孩子的少部分族群擁有，富人當道掌握大部分資源，多數窮苦人家出生的孩子，都不會有夢幻般且無憂無慮的愉快童年，筆者從小被灌輸『萬般皆下品，唯有讀書高』刻板觀念，又因為道德價值觀不准許自己做出抗拒長輩的行為，所以不管遇到甚麼不合理的行為，作為子女的我都只能乖乖接受。值得慶幸的是，現今台灣社會沒有發生過如此大規模的流血革命，這代表我們仍未失去身為人類的理性，不過家庭暴力、弒親慘劇、性侵幼童等社會案件層出不窮，到底問題出在哪裡？如果有一天大家獲取的資源都一樣，每個人都能自由選擇想要度過的童年，親人之間的不和諧就會就此消失嗎？答案當然是不可能的，因為不同個體不可能有共同的價值觀，價值觀不同就會產生衝突，家庭和樂跟世界和平一樣都是遙不可及的夢想。


《絕對絕望少女》是款值得一玩的遊戲嗎？假如說你是曾經玩過《Danganronpa》系列的玩家，那麼本作是你絕對不容錯過的番外作品，如果只是純粹想要找款射擊遊戲來玩的話，那麼不太建議購買這款【粉絲取向】的遊戲，以系列作粉絲的角度來看，故事劇情方面相比正傳較為普通，爆點也早在意料之內，廣受好評的學級裁判被完全移除，雖說如此，本作仍存在不少優點，首次採用第三人稱射擊遊戲玩法、結合前作捏他的彩蛋接連不斷地出現、以及末世悲愴感一絲不苟的完整體現。我們會在街道上看見滿地的成人屍體，到處都是以肉塊組成的裝置藝術，面對革命孩童不尋常的思維與行為，確實會讓人不禁捏把冷汗，隨著故事進展，玩家會在絕望的深淵中發現名為希望的微弱光芒，這正是《Danganronpa》世界的醍醐味，畢竟它是透過負面教材點醒人類必須積極向上的優質遊戲啊！


優點：
+遊戲內容全繁體中文化，翻譯品質優秀，不會有機械翻譯造成的閱讀障礙。
+八種言彈都有其獨特用途，結合八大言彈的特性，過關斬將以及破解謎題。
+遊戲整體難度偏易，謎題的提示取得容易，關卡設計親民，對新手很友善。
+透過日本萌系畫風詮釋社會議題，展現出不和諧的家庭會產生怎樣的結果。


缺點：
-人物肢體動作僵硬，劇情發展一本道沒有驚喜轉折，算是美中不足之處。


結論：完美補足了一二代之間的劇情空隙，表現誠意十足的外傳性質作品。


網誌圖文好讀版：
http://mgrim214.blogspot.com/2017/09/danganronpa-ultra-despair-girls.html

34797681.review:
当年在PSP上游玩了弹丸论破的第一部作品以后才开始对这个系列的作品产生兴趣。而在看到这款游戏的介绍后也不是很感冒。感觉这只是一个衍生产品，上次促销就直接买了包。直到最近才翻出来玩了一下。感觉作为一款衍生产品算是中规中矩，虽然游戏过程中不乏一些亮点和有趣的彩蛋，但是单独作为一款ACT（TPS）？来看的确是不那么尽如人意。打击感不足，动作不够自然，时不时出现卡视角，而且射击不够流畅的情况。再加上即时演算动画动作尴尬的通病，作为ACT游戏我只能打出及格，但是抛开以上几点不谈。作为一款粉丝向的游戏倒是难得一见的精致，CG和原画确实非常出彩，再加上给系列本身的美术风格就别具一格。该作作为粉丝向游戏可以算作优秀。
如果是《弹丸论破》系列的粉丝倒是非常推荐。如果只是一个想看萌妹子打怪的玩家不如去试试其它游戏。

34657966.review:
10—12小时左右的剧情流程，填补了12之间剧情空缺，以后期剧情处理来说本作丝毫不逊色于1 2，收集要素相比1 2而言也简单挺多，各种不同的言弹和翔模式配合及新要素下整体而言不会让玩家在游戏中感到很无聊，每章结束还会根据评价来对十神进行sm，不过作为fps移植来说，这作的视角锁定是比较糟糕的，游戏时也不能够随时保存游戏进度而退出，而是必须得寻找存档点（好在存档点设置的比较多），不过总体而言移植的依旧算是比较全面的，除了个别收集触发剧情要素没有全面的对话语音外，其他剧情对话都有完整的对话语音，在进行3d层面的进步后也不忘加入2d动画来渲染剧情，官方全面更新后带中文也是表示很良心（作品里甚至一部分小文本细节都汉化了），腐困大胜利！





顺带一提，困妹好萌，困妹我的不准反驳！

34657369.review:
Фанатам серии брать обязательно - это не спин-офф, а полноценное продолжение первой части. События происходят параллельно со 2й и рассказывают откуда появились все эти монокумы и кто их создатель. В игре много отсылок к предыдущей части, так что кто не играл вряд ли поймет сюжет в полной мере.
Геймплейно же Спайк Ли решили поэкспериментировать в этот раз и превратили игру в этакий аркадный шутанчик. В игре нет этих многочасовых хождений и поисков улик - только острел монокум с боссами и чередование длинных/коротких диалоговых сценок, которые достойны отдельного упоминания. Сохраняться посреди диалога, кстати, уже не дают - для этого отвели специальные места, разбросанные по уровню, но это не создает каких-то проблем - игра и так очень легкая.
Про графику в таких играх обычно не говорят, но я бы похвалил проведенную работу над этим ремастером с виты. -
Текстурки не мозолят глаз, есть сглаживание, 3D модельки персонажей заглядение - анимированы и проработаны на 5. Да, кстати, это ведь тоже нововведение!
Ну и самое главное - сюжет с диалогами как обычно выше всяких похвал. Это единственное, что позволяло закрыть глаза на репетативный и унылый геймплей в предыдущих частях, а тут он показывает себя еще лучше на фоне довольного бодрого экшона. Мой совет - ищите и собирайте валяющиеся по уровню книжки - диалоги Омару с Фукавой это нечто

34655524.review: Будучи фанатом первых двух частей игры (хотя эта часть скорее является спин-оффом), тем не менее я весьма настороженно отнесся к Ultra Despair Girls. Во-первых, я был почему-то уверен, что в спин-оффе освещаются события, которым в арке Надежды одноименного аниме посвящен эпизод длинной в пару минут. На самом деле тот эпизод хронологически происходит позже, а таймлайн этой части приходится аккурат перед началом Goodbye Despair. Так же я не очень понял по скринам как вообще играть в Ultra Despair Girls, игравшие в первые две части меня поймут - там была визуальная новелла с вкраплениями геймплея, в виде эпизодических прогулок по локациям и поисков улик, а здесь нечто похожее на полноценную игру, пусть перекос геймплей/заставки здесь все равно примерно 30/70. Да и вообще я слабо представлял, что Дангаронпу можно было превратить в, пусть и весьма аркадный, но шутер. На самом деле по атмосфере, как это ни смешно, Ultra Despair Girls мне больше всего напомнила серию Resident Evil, а точнее более традиционные их части вплоть до четвертой. Геймплей, поделенный на стрельбу и решение загадок тому лишнее подтверждение. Кстати о загадках: Чем дальше к концу игры, тем сложнее становятся головоломки, но не только потому, что они сложнее, дело также и в логике тех, кто их придумывал. Возьмем для примера загадку с четырьмя мишками и паролем, где подсказкой служит зеркало, мол это цифра, которую может увидеть сама главная героиня, а так как лично она цифры пароля увидеть не может, ибо те расположены за стеной, следовательно она цифр не видит, следовательно нужная цифра - 0. Логично? Но ноль тоже является цифрой, и надеяться на то, что любой человек будет мыслить подобным образом глупо, если уж делать головоломки с зеркалами, то нужно было делать ставки на перевернутые цифры. И вообще головоломок в игре очень много, много настолько, что они после первой половины игры уже изрядно утомляют, благо разработчики оставили возможность просто перестрелять всех противников в большинстве комнат, а реально сложную загадку с днем рождения сына, если вы тупите, решат за вас другие персонажи, за что разработчикам тоже спасибо, ибо я так и не понял логику этой задачки, впрочем, вполне соглашусь и с тем, что я не очень хорош в головоломках, да и в принципе мне было лень думать. Вообще игра в силу своей небольшой продолжительности пытается заставить вас обыскивать каждый угол в поисках записок, книг, умений и значков Воинов, если будете стараться найти и обыскать все, но не захотите переигрывать, если что-то пропустите или получите плохую оценку за главу, то потратите ~10 часов на прохождение, как я. Если вам будет лень решать загадки и искать спрятанные находки, то уложитесь и в 6-7 часов. Но чтобы реально найти абсолютно все и получить все возможные достижения, придется задержаться по-крайней мере часов на 15-20, что, в принципе, тоже не очень много. Ultra Despair Girls не может похвастаться продолжительностью наравне с оригинальными двумя частями, но предлагает настоящий геймплей и вносит в серию живую струю, путем эксперимента с жанром. Но это все та же Данганронпа со старой-доброй атмосферой и закрученным сюжетом, который действительно может удивить вас хотя бы пару раз. Отдельный поклон за концовку, где я выбрал нужный вариант, просто потому что от природы параноик, было действительно интересно наблюдать, правильный ли вариант я выбрал. В общем советую всем любителям франшизы, новичкам советую все же начать с первой части, игры серии Данганронпа сильны прежде всего сюжетом, а если вы не будете знать подоплеку происходящих событий, то не получите от Ultra Despair Girls и половины удовольствия, которое она может принести, пусть все нужные события вам и перескажут через диалоги и записки. 9 из 10.

34653450.review:
我永远喜欢困妹[spoiler]的欧派[/spoiler].jpg
玩到第二章。说一下感想：
基本上全程对话都有配音，而不是像正传那样对话推理过程只有部分配音，可喜可贺
人物建模和立绘都高清化了，但是过场时的3D动画的分辨率却比较感人
毕竟是之前只是掌机游戏，人物动作和设计手感都比较江硬，需要自己适应一下
[spoiler] 困妹的奶子最棒了[/spoiler]
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
一周目完结，追加评测：
总游戏时间20小时左右，加上序章和终章一共七章节，整体内容还是比较充实的。
想获得章节优秀评价的话需要满足的条件比较多，解密和收集缺一不可
（然而作为FPS玩家我只想突突突）
结局安排还是比较让人意外的，[spoiler] 最终章实在不知道如何选择的建议看攻略[/spoiler]
但是最终boss战[spoiler] 帝王黑白熊[/spoiler]的时候出现了屏幕卡顿的情况，不知道是自身电脑问题还是游戏BUG。
[spoiler]打完GE 突然很期待困妹黑化成绝望二代的样子[/spoiler]

剧情其实是少见的比较元气不怎么虐的（珍惜这一作吧，v3和动画简直是往粉丝头上喂屎）

34554403.review:
這遊戲製作非常用心, 有很多動畫和彈丸論破獨有的"卡紙效果"的過場劇情。
故事進行得非常詳細, 雖然表面上一直在關卡中走路打怪, 但途中極高密度地不斷發生故事劇情, 目的地一直有原因地改變。
對於喜歡看動畫的人, 會非常滿足。

但對於單純追求槍戰爽快度的人, 並不適合。
地方非常之大, 但敵人密度卻很低, 於固定位置一批幾隻的出現, 射幾槍就打完了。傾向想你智取, 而不是力敵。
途中亦有不少要求你一槍全滅敵人的小遊戲, 用來計算關卡評價。

另外, 針對故事上, 有幾點值得注意的地方:
1. 雖然玩起來很歡樂, 笑料百出; 但背景是令人絕望的大量殺人事件, 其實很恐怖的。
2. 敵人全是小孩子, 所以, 不能介意遊戲中出現很多幼稚的對話。(有些成年人可能會受不了。)
3. 女主角苗木困的思想也停留在小孩子階段。不要被她的身高騙了, 她由國中開始就被監禁了1年半, 世間事十問九不知的。

建議:
看完在這裡的腐川冬子的表現後, 大家再去看一次未來篇吧!

34541499.review:
[h1]女汉子系列之狂扁小盆友[/h1]

※熟悉的BGM
※逗比的黑白熊（扭屁股那段真的魔性）
※脑洞大开的设定
※近乎绝望的END

风格一新的弹丸系列，虽然加入了fps元素，但算不上真正的fps或是act，[strike] 手感有点渣	[/strike]，还有这逆天的十几G的大小是怎么回事(ˉ▽ˉ；)...
故事发生在一代和二代之间（其实二代电影院那张宣传海报就已经放出本作的彩蛋了），本作主角是一代主角的妹妹和腐川，ps：“待援者”都是和一代角色有关的亲属（和猫？），剧情上大致就是讲两个女汉子如何吊打小盆友，也顺便补全了狛枝消失一段时间的情节，以及黑白熊的由来，难度上，，额，表示真没啥难度，但凡玩过fps游戏的玩家就算手残也应该没难度，何况还有一个连续杀人魔级别这么imba的外挂做后盾，真为那些小盆友们担心 (lll￢.￢)
也期待下马上登陆的V3*★,°*:.☆(￣▽￣)/$:*.°★* 。撒花

Tips：第三章之后闪退bug超多，建议窗口运行，可解决~

34533290.review: I recommend it even more!,  I havn't been involved with any other of the Danganropa games but I picked this up on the PS4 the day it was realsed.   I no longer am on PS4 and moved to PC gaming.   After replenishing my collection with this game on PC and playing it i'm happy to report this port is well done.  The graphics are great.  It supports the Xbox 360 and PS4 controlers without a hitch as long as you configure them in steam.  The main girl of the story is adorable and I dont find myself skipping the script.  I wan't to hear everything they are saying.  English voice on most parts of the game. There are some parts (interuldes) that are just text.  The villians are amazing.  This game is a brilliant display of story telling that takes you into this world soaking all it's dark zanny glory.   The script made me smile when the villians introduced themselfs.  It's not all story there is also parts where you move around and shoot bears and some parts are easy as hell puzzles/games.  Works perfectly on SLI (overkill).  Man, this game is really good for the price. If you like anime this is a no brainer.   I appreicate this game and thank you for having it here.

34529326.review:
This game.
This game is what psychopop would mean. This game only makes sense when you don't search for it, and let it creep upon you on its own, let it cripple you, disturbing, wrong.
Everything in this game is wrong and disturbing. It takes things that are dark and presents them so indirectly that it's more shocking than those things themselves; wraps razors in polka-dot papers and smiles at you while shoving it down your throat. 
Things that are so out of place it feels absurd, and that's what this game is - a load of absurd that turns out more realistic than you want it to be - for the things that are worst in it have nothing to do with fiction or made-up story.
You can complain that the models look like they didn't even try - but are you there for models? Danganronpa is colourful, vivid and yet dark despite it; it's a patchwork of things, those meaningless generalized, those important cropped out, something that this game's very menu represents well.
It doesn't tell you to contemplate the plot after you finish it - you're supposed to be pulled by it when you play and when you play only. 
Many games reach for shocking content to become successful through controversy - Danganronpa does something different: it takes things that people just don't find worth as good shocking value, and almost belittles them, through this doubling on their weight felt by the player. 
And most of the times you wonder HOOOW THE FFFFFLYING FFFFUCK THEY GOT AWAY WITH IT?! It's crossing every line and breaking every rule - and not the rules anyone should be proud of breaking.
This game is a worthy piece, that ties all loose ends from two games before, and does much better work on presenting the motives than the previous did. It's never boring, not overextended, Even though not very complex.
It's disgusting.
It's adorable.
This game is OH MY GOD, followed by OH, GOD and OH GOD PLEASE NO within minutes. 
You need steel nerves to go through it, you need to know many things, you need to bear with things. Another Episode feels like a MOTHERCAWING ROADKILL - it damages you on many levels, but you cannot - must not - avert your eyes. Just like you need to learn to cope with reality that is far from happy ends and good choices. Even if it hurts. 
The struggle doesn't end when you learn its nature. Life isn't worth only aiming for goal and achieving it, but its worth lies in how much struggle you're willing to put to carry on.
And I sincerely wish I could have murdered Toko and mutilate her corpse each time a chapter ended.

A great addition to the DGR series. This game takes place in between Trigger Happy Havoc and Goodbye Despair (the first two games) in the storyline. 

The game itself was different than the other games but still good. The change in gameplay to a shooter worked well as a sidestory addition to the series yet I would rather have games in the main storyline follow the regular style of gameplay.

The characters were interesting with a look into the futures of some characters from the first game and the past from characters from the second. 

9/10 a great gaming experience, but the graphics and gameplay could improve a little. (Would only reccomend if familiar with DGR series)

34304882.review:
If you are wondering whether or not you should play the other DanranRonpa games before this one, I highly recommend it. I mean, you can watch the anime too, but playing the games gives you a better experience, for sure. Great series!

This game sounds like a spin-off, but it plays a core part to the DanganRonpa storyline as a whole. It puts you in the shoes of Makoto Naegi's sister, as well as Toko from the 1st game. This game has everything you like about DanganRonpa: great story, great characters, tense moments, shocking and gruesome imagery of despair, and even some 4th wall-breaking humor! And of course, the great story of friendship, hope, and despair! 

This game isn't as long as other DanganRonpa titles you can find on steam, as well as changes the gameplay from Visual Novel to 3rd person shooster/hack-n-slash, but its still really fun to play! 

I will post a few cons, since there are so few in there for me:
- Some textures aren't updated best for 1080p and may bug out, like Komaru's necktie or the eyes. The glitches can only be seen when characters are at a distance. 
- The aiming defaults to the center, no matter if you look up and down, which makes me adjust to the Aim Reset. It takes a while to get used to for KB/M, but works alright with controller. 

Aside from that, Solid KB/M controls for an over-the-shoulder shooter/hack-n-slash!
Have not seen any framedrops, audio clipping, or any intense graphical glitches. 

Solid PC port for the most part!

*EDIT*

34279823.review:
This game was released after Danganronpa 1 and 2, so it should be played after those two, even though it is set between those two games. 

Gameplay. Good ideas with some minor polish issues.

Gameplay wise, this is very different from the other Danganronpa games. This game is a third person survival horror type game. Its survival aspects aren’t that prevalent except on harder difficulties than normal. In fact, you have an ally that is constantly with you that can be switched to at any point. This ally is invulnerable, has melee attacks (unlimited attacks), and special attacks for extra damage. This ally is only useable when you have the meter for it, but you get a lot of refills for this meter. This meter is also continuously refilling on the easy mode, for those worried about the gameplay change and who want to get through the story easier. 

I would argue that the tension generated by being the main character with a health bar, rather than reading about the main character, provides an interesting diversion to other Danganronpa games. While there are horror elements, most of the horror comes from the situation you are facing. However, there are moments of pop up horror. If that’s a problem, keep your finger on the invincible ally button. 

A large portion of the game is puzzles. The combat itself can be quite puzzle based. 

Firstly, ammo conservation can be achieved through creative use of your special bullets. Most enemies have a specific bullet type they are particularly weak against. This weakness is not of the numerical damage kind. Some enemies can be used to kill other enemies, if you shoot them with the correct bullet. If it’s not clear, I am being deliberately cryptic. Play the game to find out. 

Secondly, there are a number of explicit puzzle rooms that require intelligent use of your special bullets to kill all the enemies in one shot, and without alerting any of them. I found most of the rooms to require some thought to get the top score. However, they can be a bit rough, in that you are technically doing the right thing, but an enemy doesn’t line up properly and you fail to get the top score. You can just shoot everything if you want a quick solution.

The gameplay is a bit rough. Everything mostly works, but it’s those little things that aren’t quite right. The critical shots are a bit harder than they should be, some puzzles don’t quite work or enemies don’t quite do what you would expect.

The save points can be annoying. You must use save points on the map and cannot save anywhere. There is a tendency to have saves at least every half hour or so of gameplay time, and often less. However, in the later part of the middle section it felt like the gap got quite big between save points. It’s possible that this is because there are more cut-scenes, and so if you were to just play a section it would still only take half an hour to reach the next save. However, there were quite a few times where I’m sure I had an hour between saves. And that continued for quite a few hours. After that point it seemed there were more saves than usual, at least.

If I were to compare this to any other game, I would say its most like Killer7. 

Story. Well written and logical, with some minor repetition.

The story is very logical and well written. It fills in many gaps in 1 and 2 that I felt were necessary to explain. It has great dramatic tension and much of that despair inducing narrative you probably like if you are playing these games. The antagonists really push the despair levels, being able to evoke immense pity, while also being able to completely nullify any pity that you might feel through immense revulsion. The plot can be a bit too slow sometimes though. The relationship between the main characters is great and grows a lot. Though it does feel a little repetitive sometimes.
The environment is a very strong part of the story. It is active and often changes, is constantly relevant to the story, and is very strong with its broad brush strokes of terror and death and despair.
 The music suits the game very well in enhancing the mood.

‘Your levity is good, it relieves tension and the fear of death’

The fan service quotient is quite a bit higher in this one, compared to 1 and 2 in the series. This was disappointing, considering the quality writing that these games are known for. But I personally feel that the horror and discomfort levels in this game are also quite a bit higher than in 1 and 2. So I think this may have been somewhat used as an attempt to balance the mood. Some of the fan service stuff is also deliberately used later on as part of the story, so some of it does have a part in the story. 

Overall I don’t think it is quite as good as Danganronpa 1 or 2. However, at its best it is certainly worthy of those two. At its worst, it’s a little frustrating in terms of lack of polished gameplay, or a little slow in terms of moving on to the next plot element.

Dieses Spiel ist etwas anders aufgebaut als die ersten beiden Teile. Wer also auf dasselbe Gameplay hofft, ist hier falsch (und sollte vielleicht auf den dritten Teil warten, der bald erscheint). In diesem Danganronpa-Spiel ist man freier in den Bewegungen und muss nun auch kämpfen, was jedoch sehr einfach gehalten ist - sowohl normale Gegner als auch Bosse. Gut finde ich, dass sie auch verschiedene Typen von Gegnern eingebaut haben. Dafür fällt nun die Detektivarbeit weg. 
Storymäßig knüpft dieses Spiel sehr gut an den ersten Teil an und stellt immer wieder Verbindungen her.
Die Cutscenes haben sich verbessert und sind teilweise um einiges "Anime-lastiger" geworden, sodass man sagen könnte, dass Ausschnitte aus einem Anime stammen würden.
Man kann hier einiges erkunden und es gibt viele versteckte Items, die teilweise Gespräche zwischen Toko und Komaru ergeben.

Was in diesem Spiel jedoch vermehrt auffällt ist, dass es hier hin und wieder etwas Fanservice gibt.

Und nach wie vor liebe ich einfach diese Monokumas <3

34262120.review:
Сразу скажу - я абсолютный фанат данганронпы, я переиграл все игры, я прочитал все новеллы, читал мангу.
Так вот, давайте начну с геймплея:
Он хорош. Для данганронпы. Да, именно, для данганронпы. Потому-что сама по себе данганронпа не должна быть шутером, это игра, в которой ты вникаешь в сюжет(Сразу проспойлерю - шикарный сюжет). Но давайте я вам все-таки НОРМАЛЬНО расскажу об этом геймплее.
В начале игры Комару получает оружие, похожее на этакий мегафон, которое называется Hacking Gun(Сразу же говорю, что я не буду ничего русифицировать, ибо это бред). У этого оружия есть 8 видов пуль(Truth bullets), которые открываются по мере прохождения игры(Спасибо, Наг...слуга!). Но именно во время перехода из одной локации(Именно тогда идет этакий шутер) в другую в основном лично у меня не возникала необходимость использовать любой другой тип патронов, кроме первого, который есть в самом же начале. Тсть, в основном ты бегаешь туда-сюда и пытаешься стрелять в слабое место Монокум, не более.
Но есть и вторая часть геймплея. Это головоломки, которые надо решать при помощи своего же оружия. Помогает же в этом(Или же наоборот?) Monoku-man машина, которая показывает тебе задачу и ты должен ее выполнить. Кстати, можно просто всех и вся уб...выключить и можно будет пройти дальше, но ты не получишь очки в конце эпизода.
Да, забыл сказать, что здесь есть головоломки, которые даются детьми. Они обычно, как и головоломки monoku-man машины, довольно легки, но иногда даже заставляют задумываться.
Далее пойдем по сюжету. Он шикарен, но на самом деле это и не удивительно, спасибо Кадзутаке Кодаке.
Персонажи тоже клевые, которые ведут себя КАК ПЕРСОНАЖИ, а не как картонные и немотивированные персонажи из какого-нибудь третьесортного аниме. 
И да, анозер эпизод заставляет тебя пробегать весь уровень только ради того, чтобы узнать сюжет. Даже я, вроде, пробегав все и вся собрал не все ништяки, что печально :(
Вывод:
Если ты фанат данганронпы - бери.
Любишь добротный и интересный сюжет? Купи первую игру/посмотри аниме-адаптацию и сразу иди покупать эту игру. Ну и конечно смотри последующее аниме и сыграй в те же игры :)
Эта игра не экшен. Эта игра как этакое кино, в котором ты немного играешь. Напоминает всякие хеви рейны, но мне сюжет в днг очень и очень нравится.
И да, не ломайте контроллер, это важно!

33890915.review:
Score: 6.5/10
Time to 100%: 20 hours

One just for the fans.

PROS:

[b]Story[/b] - Amongst the Danganronpa series this game has easily the darkest of the storylines, for reasons such as[spoiler] torture, betrayal, murder, sexual abuse[/spoiler] and all for the most part involving [spoiler]children no less[/spoiler]. It is a pleasure (or displeasure?) to play thorugh if only to see how things turn out for the characters involved and its the primary reason to play through this game. 

[b]Characters[/b]- The characters in the game - specifically the bad guys - are fascinating individuals in their own right. They're full of different neurosis and demented backgrounds. Their history is unravlled through their breakdowns and from books scattered throughout the game shedding some light on why they are just so f'ed up. There's also the appearance of a very special someone.

CONS: 

[b]Gameplay[/b]- It's pretty basic third-person shooter fare with substandard level designs with poor looking graphics. Although in all fairness, this is a port of a PS Vita game so just bare that in mind. It's also extremely easy as most enemies in the game will die in one shot if you hit them in the right place, even on the hardest difficulty. 

[b]Other Characters[/b] - So in the pros I had mentioned that the BAD guys are the interesting characters. That's because for the most part the good guys, namely the two main characters are not interesting AT ALL. Let's start with Toko. I never liked her in the first game and I still don't like her now. She's whiny, neurotic, annoying and insulting pretty much all the time and while they try to give her some kind of character development it falls far too short as she's still just as irritating as she's always been. Then there's the main character who is so bland and boring that they constantly make jokes about this fact again and again. We get it, you're normal and boring, okay great. 

So in conclusion, play this for the great story and certain characters if you're a fan of the series. As it is worthy of a playthrough and fills in some of the gaps between the first and the second game. And need a fix before Danganronpa 3 comes out!

33882644.review:
This particular facet to the DanganRonpa series didn't feel quite as fluid as the others in terms of character motivations and dialogues, etc, but rather than blindly trying to bond with over a dozen potentially murderable characters, you get to do a lot of bonding between Komaru and Toko, so the subplot is much more rewarding in this one. 

Of course, if you haven't played the other installments in the series, this game will most likely be lost on you, given how many references there are to original cast characters, though this game can still be enjoyed as a stand alone if you don't mind missing a lot of minor things. 

The gameplay is a bit clunky though, as far as third person shooters go, but the different types of truth bullets and the different ways to customize each one kind of make up for it. 

Overall, I think this game was necessary to clear things up about the first game, and the show, and it did a pretty good job of it.

33656355.review:
Jeu a posséder pour les fans de la licence Danganronpa, a faire après avoir fait les 2 premiers jeux sous risque de se faire spoil ces derniers.


Points positifs :
-L'univers de Danganronpa toujous aussi dément.
-Très bon portage, les options graphiques sont assez suffisantes (résolution, AA, ombres etc...) et sa troune a 60 fps constant.
-Bon scénario, assez prenant avec un bon final. Pas mal de dialogues bien doublés (en jap du moins) et interessants. Quelques cinématiques animés agréables a regarder, les autres sont faites soient avec déssinés ou en "carton" fidèles a la série. La plupart sont pré-enregistrès avec le moteur du jeu.


Points négatifs :
-Gameplay très moyen, sa se résume a tirer sur les points faibles des monokumas qui sont tout le temps les memes. Il y a un système de niveaux qui n'apportent pas grand chose en soi hormis la possibilités d'avoir plus de passifs a équiper. Les combats avec Toko sont ininteressants, on se contente de spammer une touche pour se défaire des ennemis.



Points négatifs :
-Le son déconne dans les cinématiques ou les réglages qu'on a fait ne sont pris en compte. Elles sont toujours joués a 100%.
-Caméra trop proche du personnage et aucune possibilité de la régler en profondeur.
-Rythme assez irrégulier, il y a parfois beaucoup trop de cinématiques et dialogues pour peu de temps de gameplay.
-Il manquerai peut etre un chapitre ou deux, les différents passés des enfants ne sont hélas pas assez approfondies. De plus le chapitre 3 est beaucoup trop court comparé aux autres.

33645382.review:
I really wanted to like the game since I thoroughly enjoyed Danganronpa. However, this game is horrible. I couldn't stomach the gameplay for more than 10 minutes at a time. 

The gameplay is super simplistic and seems to have been thrown as an afterthought. You run around in a 3D world shooting using your gun. And you fight 1-3 Monokuma at a time. If you can always aim at their eye (head) you kill them instantly. Yawn...

After that boring running around 1-shotting then you have to put up with the protagonist constantly questioning everything. Toko doesn't make it easier since she's super annoying in this game. I'm sorry to say, the story and bad gameplay weren't enough to get me past, what I think was, chapter 1.

I suggest watching the story in a video or stream. Very unhappy with this purchase.

花了一个通宵通了这个游戏，心里感觉就想被喂了shit一样。剧情乱七八糟，人物性格反复无常，通篇玩下来，一万个萌豚的捏他情节（这种情节根本就不需要，完全就是脱节奏，把剧情和人物性格变得更加人摸不到头脑）。虽说作为外传，但是已经失去的原本的风格。在一二代的游戏风格保留上看不到一点点的影子（不要跟我说什么这根本篇无关，是个外传什么什么的，2D动画加3D动画再加上弹丸特色的纸片动画的混合CG是个什么玩意）。通篇不得要领，前部着边，后不着调。作为弹丸的老粉，你的一些臭毛病我也能忍了，最后弄了那么多选项还是一个个点过来，反派人物性格弄得再怎么糟糕也是可以认的。虽说是外传不过还是有主线剧情在里面还算欣慰，不过你好歹把人物的心路历程做的好一点好吗？这种僵硬的转换我只能想到能让某站人民高潮的弱智萌豚番。如果是萌豚的话，玩了这个游戏估计开心死了。人物又萌，还有点小小福利彩蛋。估计玩不到一半就要过来吹了。但我要说这个游戏对于真的想体验一款好游戏的人来说，真的不推荐。虽然我是正版党，但是如果有剧情粉想补完剧情的话，推荐三大妈。








再补一句，听说你V3做的很棒啊？喂广大粉丝吃翔的滋味想必畅快无比吧。反正我是退坑了。这个游戏在2代就已经死在我心里了。再见，曾经的神作。不论有多少爱过你，终究是无法阻止你的创作者把你变成深渊里的一坨翔。



再见，希望之峰学园。再见，诚哥。

33491992.review: I'm very biased since I LOVE the Danganronpa franchise, but this game is pretty good. It's a third-person shooter, which is a nice change of pace from the visual-novel style of DR1 and DR2. The story for this game is probably the darkest in terms of the Hope's Peak arc, but it still has that classic Danganronpa storytelling that keeps you intrigued the whole way through. Gameplay is meh, but if you're already a fan, you're picking it up for the story anyways.

33490515.review:
Danganronpa Another Episode: Ultra Despair Girls is best played with as little spoilers as possible.
The story is entertaining and despite not being part of the "Numbered Series" its still Canon.
(Set between DG 1 and 2)

I would recommend reading Danganronpa 1 before this because this game spoils a major plot twist from DG1.

PROS:

The game looks better than I expected. Its a well done port of the PS Vita original. Looks lovely at 1080p and runs at 60 FPS and doesn't require a demanding system.
Supports Xbox 360 Gamepad.

The story: It keeps you going and gets better as you understand the antagonists motivations.
Surprisingly dark writing at times despite the daft tone. Makes you feel for the situation.

Funny, with plenty of WTF moments that the series is known for.

Awesome Music. (Although a lot of songs were used in DG1)

Great English voice acting, also lets you listen to Japanese voices if you prefer. Best of all, so much of the dialogue has voice acting except for extra stuff.

Nice and colourful with wacky background art. 

Arcade Machine Puzzles are optional. You have to pass them but you don't have to 
do it perfectly.

The Servant. Enough said.

CONS:

Repetitive gameplay and too easy. It got boring to play near the end.

Being a Vita game, when multiple people are on the screen they have washed out colour with no features. This looks pretty jarring during some moments.
 ("Yes, Adult F really contributed to this conversation!")

The game deducts your end of Chapter score if you chose to restart a checkpoint in case you screw a puzzle up.
==

It took me 20 Hours to finish. I would say most of that was dialogue instead of gameplay.
Since I played Offline, my hours were not tracked by Steam.

Overall, a solid game. I personally wouldn't say its as good as DG 1 and 2 but its definitely worth it for the story.

33475174.review:
First things first, excellent port as always. Never had a single problem with the game, and it didn't feel lazy in any way (borderless is highly appreciated).

Even so, I was hesitant to buy this after hearing people say it's a side-story or that the anime already spoils the story. What's the point of playing this if you already know how it's going to end?

Nothing could be further from the truth. This is a meaty, gripping story that any DR shouldn't pass up on. In a way, I actually think this story is overall the best in the series so far, partly owing to the fact it builds on top of the already established lore to subvert expectations. It has lots of twists and turns along the way, to the point that it feels like the entire ending sequence is one long payoff consisting in large part of well-executed knife twists and solid character development. I don't want to say too much to avoid spoiling anything, but I feel deeply satisfied after having finished the game. It won me over very quickly and then just piled on the goodies all the way to the end and beyond.

I also liked the change to the mechanics. I thought the shooting aspect would be tolerable at best, but there's actually a lot of variety to it, so it never gets boring or overly hard. I'd definitely like to see more of this in the future.

As for the music, I have to once again give props to Masafumi Takada (big fan here) for bringing his best to the table. Sometimes I wonder whether the DR series feels for him like an outlet for his bizarre style. The area music in particular really gives off that killer7 vibe which is another thumbs-up in my book.

All in all, UDG is a must-play for any DR fan, and the PC version is the definitive one. Make sure to pick it up sooner or later, but only after experiencing DR 1 and 2 for maximum enjoyment.
